scenario: Intel (INTC) declined 61% in 2024, the steepest decline among the bottom five names on the Nasdaq-100 index. The company's struggles are attributed to its failure to adapt to changing times, particularly the decline of its core PC market. Fellow tech sector companies MongoDB and Microchip Technology also declined, due to factors such as lower-than-expected guidance and revenue declines. Healthcare companies DexCom and Biogen, which specialize in glucose monitoring products and biotech, respectively, also saw significant declines, with investors fearing obsolescence and regulatory rejections. While four of the five companies may have potential for rebound, Intel's prospects are seen as limited due to its uncompetitive position in the PC market.
